class.name: StringSelection
class.javadoc: A Transferable which implements the capability required to transfer a String. This Transferable properly supports DataFlavor.stringFlavor and all equivalent flavors. Support for DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor and all equivalent flavors is deprecated. No other DataFlavors are supported. java.awt.datatransfer.DataFlavor#stringFlavor java.awt.datatransfer.DataFlavor#plainTextFlavor
Creates a Transferable capable of transferring the specified String.

Returns an array of flavors in which this Transferable can provide the data. DataFlavor.stringFlavor is properly supported. Support for DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor is deprecated. an array of length two, whose elements are DataFlavor. stringFlavor and DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor

method.name: getTransferDataFlavors
method.comment: returning flavors itself would allow client code to modify our internal behavior

class.javadoc: Returns whether the requested flavor is supported by this Transferable. flavor the requested flavor for the data true if flavor is equal to DataFlavor.stringFlavor or DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor; false if flavor is not one of the above flavors NullPointerException if flavor is null

method.name: isDataFlavorSupported
method.comment: JCK Test StringSelection0003: if 'flavor' is null, throw NPE

class.javadoc: Returns the Transferable's data in the requested DataFlavor if possible. If the desired flavor is DataFlavor.stringFlavor, or an equivalent flavor, the String representing the selection is returned. If the desired flavor is DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor, or an equivalent flavor, a Reader is returned. Note: The behavior of this method for DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor and equivalent DataFlavors is inconsistent with the definition of DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor. flavor the requested flavor for the data the data in the requested flavor, as outlined above UnsupportedFlavorException if the requested data flavor is not equivalent to either DataFlavor.stringFlavor or DataFlavor.plainTextFlavor IOException if an IOException occurs while retrieving the data. By default, StringSelection never throws this exception, but a subclass may. NullPointerException if flavor is null java.io.Reader

method.name: getTransferData
method.comment: JCK Test StringSelection0007: if 'flavor' is null, throw NPE
